item.title: Report E-2024120161
item.description:
Report E-2024120161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: HUBER HTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of material released from one (1) 3,072-pound metal tote due to a loose valve resulting in a leak. The material released was Chemtrend PU14159. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel used available PPE to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120508
item.description:
Report X-2024120508

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the CVGA location a steel bucket was discovered leaking. The steel bucket was damaged on the bottom chime causing the release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report I-2024120021
item.description:
Report I-2024120021

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was offloading bleach and the gaging system stopped at 5/8 and the tank overfilled at the end cap releasing 15 gallons of material, with a portion going into containment. The overfill gage was not easily identifiable/dirty. The driver cleaned up the spill and notified EHS and dispatch. No Exposures/Injuries.

item.title: Report E-2024110558
item.description:
Report E-2024110558

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T00:59:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-16
  • City: FREEPORT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Prior to loading, the driver decided to clean the hose and a rag was sucked into the hose. When the pump was reversed to push the rag out, the pressure was too high and caused a release of material.
